properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter is not over yet. Significant snowfall and strong winds expected beginning Friday afternoon. Total snowfall: 10 cm or more. Maximum wind gusts: 80 km/h or higher. Locations: Postville to Makkovik. Time span: Friday afternoon through Saturday morning. Remarks: Periods of snow will begin Friday afternoon and become heavier Friday night. Strong northwesterly winds will also develop gusting to 80 km/h or higher and cause reduced visibility in blowing snow. Conditions will improve on Saturday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-22T10:47:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T18:48:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1270717290.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Is Being Issued By Village Of Stewart Valley
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Stewart Valley. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Stewart Valley water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-06-05T16:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-05-21T06:59:42-06:00, 97A9D821-2D5C-A4E0-BD49-75C8CE99F1A6
Area: Village of Stewart Valley
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of severe northwesterly winds are occurring in Coral Harbour. Winds gusting over 90 km/h will slowly subside this afternoon. These winds will occasionally give reduced visibilities in blowing snow but at this time prolonged blizzard conditions are not expected. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T00:59:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T14:29:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1161014412.2020
Area: Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system over southern BC will bring showers to the region today and Friday. Snow level will lower to 1300 to 1500 metres tonight and rise to 1700 to 1900 metres Friday afternoon. Over highway 3 - Paulson summit to Kootenay Pass, showers will change to snow this evening with local amounts up to 15 cm near Kootenay Pass by Friday morning. Snow will taper off to a few flurries or rain showers Friday afternoon. Over the Okanagan connector, up to 5 cm snow accumulations are possible near the summit tonight. Snow will taper off or change to rain showers Friday morning. Over the Allison Pass, showers may change to flurries near the summit this evening with possibly up to 2 cm snow accumulation tonight. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T08:55:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T16:56:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3797335394.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass, Okanagan Connector - Merritt to Kelowna
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The blizzard with very strong westerly winds giving poor to nil visibility in snow and blowing snow will continue into this evening. The winds are expected to slowly diminish beginning this evening, and the blizzard conditions will also slowly improve tonight. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T05:59:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T22:39:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3211634585.2020
Area: Ivujivik, Akulivik, Salluit, Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong northwesterly winds combined with falling snow will continue to bring blizzard conditions to the Naujaat region today. A weather disturbance tracking across Baffin Island is currently bringing strong northwesterly winds and blizzard conditions to the Naujaat region. Conditions are expected to improve this evening as winds start to diminish. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T03:59:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T19:19:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2524623292.2020
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. Freezing rain is expected to begin late this evening and will persist into Friday morning. The main band of freezing rain is expected to set up between Collins Bay and Southend, with the heaviest precipitation occurring over northern portions of Reindeer Lake. Some areas may experience a period of freezing rain before the precipitation turns over to snow or ice pellets. The freezing rain should end by noon Friday. ### Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T13:32:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T21:33:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2958833879.2020
Area: Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay, Southend - Brabant Lake - Kinoosao
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong winds have developed in the region and will persist into this evening before weakening. Gusts approaching 100 km/h have been reported at the Waterton Park Gate station. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T07:00:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T23:14:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4097716067.2020
Area: M.D. of Ranchland, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Cowley Burmis and Maycroft, Piikani Reserve, Municipality of Crowsnest Pass including Coleman and Frank, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Beauvais Lake Prov. properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds with severe and damaging gusts are expected or occurring. Severe winds continue in the Kinngait region today. Wind gusts in the 90 to 110 km/h range will continue today then gradually diminish Thursday night. In addition to the winds visibilities may at times be reduced in snow and blowing snow, however no prolonged blizzard conditions are expected at this time. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T00:38:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T08:39:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3508835686.2020
Area: Cape Dorset
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system approaching from southern Saskatchewan will bring a mix of precipitation to northern Manitoba tonight and Friday. An area of rain turning to freezing rain is expected to develop this evening in the southern Brochet, southern Tadoule , and northern Thompson regions and then spread into the Gillam and Shamattawa regions tonight. Depending on overnight temperatures, parts of Lynn Lake region may see some freezing rain tonight and early Friday. Freezing rain amounts of 5 to 10 mm are expected. Some areas in these regions may receive accumulating snow. Easterly winds gusting to 50 to 60 km/h are also forecast. This freezing rain will continue through Friday and may push through the Churchill area Friday night. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T12:32:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-21T20:33:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0356187271.2020
Area: Brochet, Tadoule Lake, South Indian Lake and Amisk Prov. Park, Split Lake and York Landing, Thompson Thicket Portage and Pikwitonei, Nelson House, Gillam, Shamattawa
properties.Author: Environment Canada
